intro: Frangula stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cascara, is a shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Frangula stenophylla is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in chaparral and coastal scrub ecosystems. Its bark and leaves have been used historically by Indigenous peoples for medicinal purposes.
